article:
The colloquial term 'nines' is used in engineering to indicate reliability or
purity (or similar quantitative descriptor). It is preceded by a number
indicating the degree of such reliability or purity. For example, 0.999 (or 99.9
percent) pure silver would be 3 nines pure. Or, for example, electricity that is
delivered without interruptions (blackouts, brownouts or surges) 99.999 percent
of the time would have 5 nines reliability. Reliability can be considered a time-
based purity. Also related are the topics of defect rates, Parts-per notation,
MTBF and MTTR.

In mathematical terms, the quantity of nines is equal to the negative common
logarithm of one minus the actual number, i.e.
−log 10 (1−n).
